ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about environmental governance, what people are trying to do, issues to adoption, etc.

I developed the skills to conduct my own research using the resources I could find online. Learned to dig deeper into environmental initiatives rather than just relying on the homepage of their website.
learnt how to critically think through policy memos and environmental regimes
Analysis of governance structures, environmental issues, and how to critically evaluate the effectiveness of a regime.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very interesting material, I just wish there was something we were working towards. The class formats are all the same, so it would be nice to have some variety or at least the anticipation of something towards the end. Instead, each week was just a new topic / environmental governance regime. It was really fascinating overall though!

Strengths - extremely interesting material. Grouped into coherent topics. Readings very useful and pertinent. 
Weaknesses - very wide scope so hard to cover all in depth.

strengths: 
professor seddon raises very interesting issues and discussions in class 

weaknesses: 
too many assignments
This course had a lot of class discussion and the lecture portions were very engaging. In the future it might be better to space out the assignments more strictly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you are interested in the topic. Professor Seddon is an expert in this field and so well connected. I think if you are younger this course would be more helpful as I think it's very eye opening / thought provoking and I can see it pairing very well with thesis / independent study type of work.
Yes I would recommend the course as long as they are aware that it is a lot of independent research compared to class time.
yes but only if assignments were toned down.

I would absolutely recommend this course. It has increased my ability to critically analyze solutions to environmental issues and was taught very well. The professor is fantastic and often brought in guests (who are also very knowledgeable) to speak.
